full_summary:
**Project Title**: Architectural and Engineering Services for a New Police Facility in Dillon, Saskatchewan

**Request for Proposal**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites qualified consultants to submit a proposal for the provision of architectural and engineering services for the design and construction of a new police facility in Dillon, Saskatchewan. The selected consultant will serve as the Prime Consultant and provide a comprehensive consulting team, including expertise in civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, and landscape architecture, as well as scheduling and commissioning.

**Project Overview**
The RCMP is seeking to design, build, and deliver a new modular police detachment facility to meet its program requirements in Dillon, Saskatchewan. The facility will have an approximate area of 899m2, and a detached storage garage of approximately 60m2. Additionally, a new sewage lift station will be required.

**Key Requirements**

* Design and construction administration services for the new police facility
* Provision of a comprehensive consulting team, including expertise in civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, and landscape architecture, as well as scheduling and commissioning
* Compliance with the RCMP's program requirements and building codes
* Coordination with the RCMP to ensure that the facility meets the security requirements

**Contract Terms**
The contract period is expected to be four years from the date of contract award, with an option for extension to align with the completion of the corresponding construction contract, including warranty periods.

**Contact Information**
For more information, please contact:

* Hengen, Teresa
* Email: teresa.hengen@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
* Phone: 639-625-3449
* Fax: 306-780-5232

**Submission Requirements**
Proposals must be submitted through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) and should include the following:

* A detailed description of the consultant's experience and qualifications
* A comprehensive proposal outlining the consultant's approach and methodology
* A detailed breakdown of the costs associated with the project

**Language**
Proposals may be submitted in either English or French. The RCMP reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

This is an Indigenous business friendly procurement. Canada encourages aboriginal businesses to submit a proposal. More information may be found at [www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory](http://www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory).<sub>1\</sub> 

**Closing Date**
The solicitation closes at 2:00pm CST on March 15, 2023.
